argument.name: start
argument.description: The index of the first element to clear.

argument.name: end
argument.description: The index of the last element to clear.

page.discussion: The <ARRAY>.CLEAR() method clears the contents of a single dimensional array. The optional Start and End arguments restrict the portion of the array that is cleared out.

section.title: Example
section.description: Assume an array "A" contains the following elements:
section.example:
dim A[8] as C A[1] = "Orange" A[2] = "Banana" A[3] = "Apple" A[4] = "Pineapple" A[5] = "Mango"
? A = [1] = "Orange" [2] = "Banana" [3] = "Apple" [4] = "Pineapple" [5] = "Mango" [6] = "" [7] = "" [8] = ""

section.description: After A.clear(3,4), the array will look like this:
To remove blank entries from an array, use the [<ARRAY>.DELETE()] method or the <ARRAY>.INITIALIZE() method. For example:
section.example:
temp = A.dump("R") A.clear(1, A.SIZE()) A.initialize(temp)
? A = [1] = "Orange" [2] = "Banana" [3] = "Mango" [4] = "" [5] = "" [6] = "" [7] = "" [8] = ""
